entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to correction; serving to correct.
examples: As the currents were changing rapidly, the captain had to make many corrective course changes.
Since the accident I've had to wear a corrective brace.

The Psalmist interposeth a caution in this corrective particle, Yea, Happy.[6] It hath the force of a revocation, whereby he seems to retract what went before, not simply and absolutely, but in a certain degree  [â€¦]

entries.meaning: Something that corrects or counteracts something.
examples: penalties are correctives of immoral conduct
What Correctives there may be supposed that may check and restrain that Increase of Mankind, that otherwise according to the ordinary course of Nature would have obtained in the World.
